str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Latin origin; a centurion, i.e. Captain of one hundred soldiers.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.
Opposite, opposed, contrary; the adversary. From enanti; opposite; figuratively, antagonistic.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (lit: I breathe out), I breathe my last, expire. From ek and pneo; to expire.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Truly, really, certainly, surely. Adverb from alethes; truly.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
